Title: 3. News Media
Write-Up Text: The federal budget has drawn a positive response from Standards and Poors but a warning that future repair to the bottom line will be needed to ensure future economic growth. The opposition says the federal government has taken half-measures to ensure cost-of-living relief for families struggling with inflation. Treasurer Jim Chalmers will today appear at the National Press Club in Canberra to continue the government's campaign to promote new budget measures. Top stories from budget night include funds for the hydrogen industry changes to Medicare investment in schools defence social welfare rural Australia a new tax for multinational corporations and improvements for the NDIS and aged care.
